overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting a 96-hour time series with limited historical points. It identifies strong daily seasonality and handles an abrupt pattern shift by excluding an inconsistent first day. The solution relies on simple averaging of recent seasonal patterns due to data constraints, with detailed hourly calculations and rounding for precision. While acknowledging limitations, it provides a practical short-term forecast.
common_data_patterns: Abrupt pattern shift (positive to negative values after first day)
Consistent hourly patterns in last three days
No missing values in input data
key_insights: Exclusion of inconsistent historical data (first day) to improve pattern reliability
Hourly averaging of recent days to capture daily seasonality
Rounding forecasts to match input data format (3 decimal places)
Recognition of data limitations preventing complex modeling
Explicit handling of datetime continuity in forecasts
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed data inspection and step-by-step calculations, but relies on fundamental heuristics due to limited historical data. Avoids advanced statistical models while demonstrating thorough pattern analysis.
